Package org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.cache

Class OcspSigningCacheEntry

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cesecore.certificates.ocsp.cache.OcspSigningCacheEntry
  • public class OcspSigningCacheEntry
extends Object
    Hold information needed for creating an OCSP response without database lookups.
    Version:
    $Id: OcspSigningCacheEntry.java 28643 2018-04-06 08:53:57Z samuellb $

    • Method Detail

      • getIssuerCaCertificate

        public X509Certificate getIssuerCaCertificate()
        Returns:
        certificate of the CA that we want to respond for

      • getCertificateID

        public List<org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.CertificateID> getCertificateID()
        Returns:
        certificate ID of the CA that we want to respond for

      • getIssuerCaCertificateStatus

        public CertificateStatus getIssuerCaCertificateStatus()
        Returns:
        the certificate revocation status for the CA that we want to respond for at the time of cache reload

      • getCaCertificateChain

        public List<X509Certificate> getCaCertificateChain()
        Returns:
        the chain of all CA certificates

      • getOcspSigningCertificate

        public X509Certificate getOcspSigningCertificate()
        Returns:
        a OCSP signing certificate or null if this cache entry will use a CA key to sign the response

      • getFullCertificateChain

        public List<X509Certificate> getFullCertificateChain()
        Returns:
        the full certificate chain that will be used to sign the OCSP response. The first position is either an OCSP signing certificate or a CA certificate.

      • getSigningCertificate

        public X509Certificate getSigningCertificate()
        Returns:
        the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP response. This is either an OCSP signing certificate or a CA certificate.

      • getSigningCertificateIssuerDn

        public String getSigningCertificateIssuerDn()
        Returns:
        the Issuer DN of the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP response. BC normalized.

      • getSigningCertificateIssuerDnRaw

        public String getSigningCertificateIssuerDnRaw()
        Returns:
        the Issuer DN of the certificate that will be used to sign the OCSP response. Not normalized.

      • getPrivateKey

        public PrivateKey getPrivateKey()
        Returns:
        the private key that will be used to sign the OCSP response.

      • getSignatureProviderName

        public String getSignatureProviderName()
        Returns:
        the signature provider that should be used with this cache entries private key.

      • getOcspKeyBinding

        public OcspKeyBinding getOcspKeyBinding()
        Returns:
        the OCSP key binding mapped by this entry or null if the private key belongs to a CA.

      • getResponderIdType

        public OcspKeyBinding.ResponderIdType getResponderIdType()
        Returns:
        one of the OcspConfiguration.RESPONDERIDTYPE_* values used by this cache entry

      • getRespId

        public org.bouncycastle.cert.ocsp.RespID getRespId()
        Returns:
        the actual responder type ASN1 object used by this cache entry

      • getResponseCertChain

        public X509Certificate[] getResponseCertChain()
        Returns:
        the part of the full certificate chain that has been configured to be included in the response.

      • isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate

        public boolean isUsingSeparateOcspSigningCertificate()
        Checks if the entry has a OCSP signing certificate separate from the certificate chain. Only entries with a keybinding can have a separate certificate.
        Returns:
        boolean

      • isSigningCertificateForOcspSigning

        public boolean isSigningCertificateForOcspSigning()
        Returns:
        false when we are using a non-CA signing certificate and the certificate lacks the OCSP signing EKU

      • isPlaceholder

        public boolean isPlaceholder()
        Returns:
        true if this entry is just a temporary placeholder that should be replaced with the default responder when rebuilding the cache.

      • checkResponseSignatureVerified

        public boolean checkResponseSignatureVerified()
        Returns:
        false for the first thread that invokes this method (a caller that gets a false return value should verify the response signature)
